title: Re-branding
content:
Currently re-branding a representational art museum for a school project. Any suggestions on typefaces to look at for the logotype?

The museum is the Frye in Seattle, [http://www.fryemuseum.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120075406/http:/www.fryemuseum.org/ "http://www.fryemuseum.org/")

Thanks to anyone willing to help!

 [‹ Complementary Serif font for Gill?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120075406/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29260 "Go to previous forum topic") [inscriptions in stone ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120075406/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29436 "Go to next forum topic")
author: shanejlong

comments.content:
oh sorry, I wasn’t clear. I dont need to know what typeface they’re using.

I was wondering if anyone had any typeface suggestions to look at for branding a representational art museum like the frye.

Hope this clears things up.
FFUnit would work. It has a warmth to it that’s quite appropriate for a museum of representational art.

Given the breadth of the collection and exhibitions, it might be worth looking at the architecture (I only had a limited view on the website admittedly) for inspiration, you could look at  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=mostra](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120075406/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=mostra "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=mostra")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/quadrat/toronto-subway/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120075406/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/quadrat/toronto-subway/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/quadrat/toronto-subway/")

[http://houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=18&subpage=viewfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120075406/http:/houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=18&subpage=viewfonts "http://houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=18&subpage=viewfonts")

Tim
Thanks so much! Some great suggestions here, if anyone has anything else I’d love to take a look, thanks!
